intro: Synadenium angolense, commonly known as the Angola milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many milkweed species. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, often with a hairy texture. Synadenium angolense produces a milky sap that contains toxic compounds, making it potentially harmful to animals and humans.
